personalInfo.family: Wife, Lorraine; Alex and Sophie (1994), Sam (1997), Aaron (2004)

tourBios.intlVics: (6): 1989 Cannes Open [Eur]. 1991 European Pro-Celebrity [Eur]. 1993 Benson and Hedges International Open [Eur]. 1995 French Open [Eur]. 2005 Estoril Open de Portugal [Eur}. 2006 Algarve Open de Portugal [Eur].
tourBios.otherInfo: Won on the European Tour for the second consecutive year for the first time in his career by defending his Algarve Open de Portugal title in April 2006. Fired a final-round 67 with a birdie on the 72nd hole to beat Anthony Wall by one stroke. Ended a 10-year span between European Tour victories with a win at the 2005 Portuguese Open. Won his fifth career European Tour title by one stroke over Paul Lawrie and Barry Lane. Suffered a serious injury to his right hand during the second round of the 2000 Dubai Desert Classic which necessitated surgery. That led to two difficult years but he regained full exempt status in 2003 and climbed to 44th on the Volvo Order of Merit in 2004 helped by three top-five finishes. Won first European Tour title at the Cannes Open in 1989. At the 1990 Open Championship, shot 63 to tie the St. Andrews course record. At the 1991 Ryder Cup at Kiawah Island, went unbeaten (2-0). Financed amateur career by working as a van driver, gardener and technician in a fiberglass factory. Credits his father, who was a 10-handicapper before losing an arm in an engineering accident, for his interest in golf.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR was T9th in 1991 at the B.C. Open.
